definitions: structural element that bears weight and provides stability
performing secondary role that assists the main performance
examples: The supporting beams kept the old building from collapsing
Engineers replaced the supporting walls with stronger materials
She played a supporting role in the Broadway production
The supporting cast delivered exceptional performances throughout the play

definitions: belief or idea based on incomplete evidence rather than proven facts
examples: Her supposition about the cause proved completely incorrect
The detective's supposition led them to investigate new suspects

definitions: forceful action to prevent something from happening, being expressed, or becoming known
examples: The suppression of free speech violated constitutional rights
Government suppression of the protest sparked international criticism

definitions: device that reduces noise from firearms or machinery
substance or mechanism that prevents or reduces biological activity
examples: The suppressor reduced the rifle's sound to safe levels
Police found an illegal suppressor attached to the weapon
The tumor suppressor gene helps prevent cancer cell growth
This immune suppressor prevents organ rejection after transplantation

definitions: person who believes their racial, ethnic, or religious group is superior
examples: The white supremacist group promoted hateful ideologies online
Supremacist movements have been condemned by civil rights organizations

definitions: state of having the highest authority, power, or status above all others
examples: Naval supremacy determined the outcome of many historical conflicts
The company maintained market supremacy for three consecutive decades

definitions: person in charge with the highest authority in an organization
examples: The fashion supremo launched her new collection in Milan
As marketing supremo, she transformed the company's brand image

definitions: chapter or section of the Quran in Islamic religious text
examples: Students memorized the entire sura for their religious studies
The imam recited a sura during the evening prayer service

definitions: extra charge added to the usual cost of something
examples: The airline imposed a fuel surcharge on all international flights
Credit card surcharges increased the total purchase price significantly

definitions: person who takes responsibility for another's debt or obligation
state of being certain or confident about something
examples: His father acted as surety for the business loan
The bank required a surety before approving the mortgage
She spoke with absolute surety about the project's success
There was no surety that the plan would actually work

definitions: foam and waves breaking on the shore or reef
casual browsing through websites or television channels
examples: The surf crashed against the rocky coastline all night
Heavy surf made swimming dangerous at the beach
She spent hours surfing the internet for vacation deals
He liked to surf channels before settling on a program

definitions: outermost layer or boundary of an object or area
superficial appearance that may differ from underlying reality
examples: The surface of the lake reflected the mountain perfectly
Scientists analyzed the surface composition of the meteorite
On the surface, their marriage seemed perfectly happy
The investigation revealed problems beneath the surface

definitions: material used to create the top layer of roads or paths
examples: The new surfacing improved road safety during wet conditions
Workers applied fresh surfacing to the damaged parking lot

definitions: long narrow board used for riding waves in surfing
examples: She waxed her surfboard before heading to the beach
The custom surfboard was designed for big wave conditions

definitions: person who rides waves on a surfboard as sport
person who browses the internet or television channels
examples: Professional surfers competed in the world championship event
The surfer caught a perfect wave at sunrise
Internet surfers often visit multiple websites during one session
Channel surfers rarely watch complete television programs

definitions: sport of riding waves on a surfboard in the ocean
activity of browsing through internet websites or television channels
examples: Surfing requires excellent balance and ocean knowledge
She learned surfing during her vacation in Hawaii
Web surfing consumed most of his evening free time
Channel surfing helped him find interesting documentaries

definitions: sudden powerful forward movement or increase in activity
strong wavelike forward movement of water or electricity
examples: The surge in unemployment worried government economists
A surge of anger made him lose his composure
The storm surge flooded coastal communities
Power surge damaged several electronic devices

definitions: medical doctor who performs operations to treat diseases, injuries, or deformities
examples: The cardiac surgeon performed a successful heart transplant
An experienced surgeon removed the tumor completely

definitions: medical treatment involving cutting into the body to repair or remove parts
place where a doctor or dentist treats patients
examples: Emergency surgery saved the accident victim's life
The surgery lasted six hours due to complications
The doctor's surgery opens at eight every morning
Patients waited in the surgery for their appointments

definitions: conclusion or opinion formed with incomplete evidence through reasoning
examples: His surmise about the outcome proved remarkably accurate
Based on the evidence, her surmise seemed quite reasonable

definitions: hereditary name shared by family members, typically following the given name
examples: Please write your surname on the application form
Her maiden surname was different from her married name

definitions: unexpected or astonishing event, fact, or thing
feeling caused by something unexpected or astonishing
examples: The birthday surprise delighted the unsuspecting guest
His resignation came as a complete surprise
Her surprise was evident when she opened the gift
To everyone's surprise, the underdog team won

definitions: twentieth-century artistic movement expressing the unconscious mind through dreamlike imagery
examples: Surrealism influenced literature, film, and visual arts worldwide
Dali's paintings exemplified the principles of surrealism

definitions: artist or writer who creates work in the surrealist style
examples: The surrealist painted melting clocks and distorted landscapes
Famous surrealists included Salvador Dali and Ren√© Magritte

definitions: act of ceasing resistance to an enemy or opponent
act of giving up possession or control of something
examples: The general announced surrender after the siege lasted months
Their surrender ended the longest battle of the war
His surrender of parental rights shocked the family
The surrender of the stolen goods came too late

definitions: four-wheeled horse-drawn carriage with two seats facing forward
examples: The surrey with the fringe on top appeared in musicals
They rode through the park in an antique surrey

definitions: person who acts as substitute or replacement for another
thing that serves as substitute or replacement
examples: The surrogate mother carried the baby for nine months
He became a surrogate father to his nephew
Coffee served as a surrogate for his usual morning tea
The doll became a surrogate child for the lonely woman

definitions: border or area that encircles something, especially decorative frame
examples: The marble surround enhanced the fireplace's elegant appearance
They installed a new tile surround for the bathtub

definitions: capital and largest city of Nepal, located in the Kathmandu Valley
examples: Tourists visit Kathmandu to explore ancient temples and palaces
Kathmandu serves as the gateway to Mount Everest expeditions

definitions: member of a Turkic people native to Kazakhstan and Central Asia
Turkic language spoken primarily in Kazakhstan
examples: The Kazakh nomads traditionally herded sheep and horses
Many Kazakhs maintain their cultural traditions despite modernization
She studied Kazakh to communicate with her grandmother
Kazakh uses a modified Cyrillic alphabet for writing

definitions: large landlocked country in Central Asia, formerly part of the Soviet Union
examples: Kazakhstan is the world's largest landlocked country by area
Oil reserves have transformed Kazakhstan's economy since independence

definitions: person who is a citizen or native of Kazakhstan
examples: The Kazakhstani athlete won gold at the Olympics
Many Kazakhstanis speak both Kazakh and Russian fluently

definitions: base unit of thermodynamic temperature in the International System of Units
examples: Water freezes at 273.15 kelvin under standard pressure
Scientists measured the temperature in kelvin for precision

definitions: relating to the English county of Kent or its inhabitants
examples: The Kentish dialect has distinctive pronunciation features
Kentish apples are famous throughout southern England

definitions: state in the southeastern United States, known for horse racing and bourbon
examples: Kentucky hosts the famous Kentucky Derby each May
Bourbon whiskey must be produced in Kentucky to be authentic

definitions: East African country on the equator, known for wildlife and diverse landscapes
examples: Kenya attracts millions of tourists for safari adventures annually
Coffee from Kenya is prized for its distinctive flavor

definitions: person who is a citizen or native of Kenya
examples: The Kenyan runner broke the marathon world record
Many Kenyans speak Swahili as their first language

definitions: metal instrument for operating a lock or starting a vehicle
crucial or essential element for understanding or achieving something
system of musical notes based on a particular note
low-lying island, especially in the Caribbean
examples: She lost her car keys at the shopping mall
The janitor carried keys for every room in the building
Education is the key to breaking the poverty cycle
Finding the key witness solved the criminal case
The song was written in the key of C major
Musicians transposed the piece to a different key
They vacationed on a small key off Florida's coast
The coral key provided habitat for numerous species

definitions: relating to economic theories of John Maynard Keynes advocating government intervention
examples: Keynesian economics supports government spending during recessions
The Keynesian approach influenced policy after the Great Depression

definitions: largest ethnic subgroup of Mongols in Mongolia
standard dialect of Mongolian language spoken in Mongolia
examples: The Khalkha Mongols comprise the majority of Mongolia's population
Khalkha traditions strongly influence modern Mongolian culture
Official documents in Mongolia are written in Khalkha
Most Mongolians speak Khalkha as their native language

definitions: collective body of initiated Sikhs founded by Guru Gobind Singh
examples: Members of the Khalsa follow specific religious codes
The Khalsa was established in 1699 in Punjab

definitions: indigenous people of western Siberia in Russia
Uralic language spoken by the Khanty people
examples: The Khanty traditionally lived as reindeer herders and fishers
Khanty culture includes rich oral traditions and shamanism
Few young people speak Khanty as their first language
Khanty has several distinct dialects across Siberia

definitions: capital city of Sudan located at the confluence of the Blue and White Nile
examples: Khartoum serves as Sudan's political and commercial center
The confluence of the Niles makes Khartoum strategically important

definitions: title of the viceroy of Egypt under Ottoman suzerainty from 1867 to 1914
examples: The khedive governed Egypt on behalf of the Ottoman Sultan
Ismail Pasha was the first to hold the title khedive

definitions: indigenous people forming the majority population of Cambodia
official language of Cambodia, also called Cambodian
examples: The Khmer built the magnificent temples of Angkor Wat
Khmer culture strongly influences Southeast Asian art
She studied Khmer to work with Cambodian refugees
Khmer script derives from ancient Indian writing systems

definitions: indigenous pastoralist people of southwestern Africa, historically called Hottentots
examples: The Khoikhoi herded cattle in southern Africa for centuries
Khoikhoi societies had complex political and social structures

definitions: indigenous peoples of southern Africa including the San and Khoikhoi
languages of southern Africa characterized by click consonants
examples: Khoisan peoples were the original inhabitants of southern Africa
Genetic studies show Khoisan peoples have ancient ancestry
Khoisan languages feature unique click sounds not found elsewhere
Only a few thousand people still speak Khoisan languages

definitions: Native American people originally from the Great Lakes region
examples: The Kickapoo Nation maintains reservations in several states
Kickapoo traditions include distinctive ceremonial practices

definitions: informal term for a child or young person
young goat, especially one under a year old
soft leather made from young goat skin
examples: The kids played in the backyard all afternoon
She has three kids in elementary school
The farmer's kid goats frolicked in the pasture
Mother goats nurse their kids for several months
Her kid gloves were perfect for the formal occasion
The artisan crafted wallets from soft kid leather

definitions: capital and largest city of Ukraine, located on the Dnieper River
examples: Kiev has been an important Eastern European city for centuries
Many historic churches and monuments are found in Kiev
